Once the edit period has expired, authors may update their posts by removing and reposting them.To read more about editing your posts, please follow this link: http://www.tripadvisor.com/help/how_to_edit_your_postsRemoved on: 3:02 pm, March 14, 2020
Stay at home! Washington state is a Coronavirus hot spot!
In PV now. Restaurants and bars are very busy in Old Town.

Yup, You are in the epicenter of Wa. States outbreak, best to err on the safe side. Cancel & stay home. If you can't gather in groups larger than 250 people or send your kids to school you should not be in an airport traveling to a foreign country. You could be in a forced 2 week quarantine when you return. Stay calm & wash your hands Safe travels  Life is good
Make sure to pack 2 weeks of extra prescription medications if you are one who takes medications on a daily basis.In your carry-on.Edited: 11:45 am, March 14, 2020
You may not get out of your country and into Mexico, things are changing by the minute/hour. You'd be better off to stay home.
To your question, post #2 is correct. Everything is open, we haven't noticed any closures, and the food is plentiful and tasty! No shortages of any kind either....
You can even get toilet paper!
What Wayne and Michael K said. Will add the weather has been wonderful. La Vida es Buena.

You probably won’t have any issues. Just be sure to have a contingency plan. In addition to taking extra medication, be sure to bring a credit card with a high limit in case you can’t get back into the country, are hospitalized, etc. Also make sure your obligations at home can be met if you have a long delay getting home.
If you are a gambler, I would look at your odds. If you are taking your kiddos, think about it.

Continues to be extremely busy; restaurants in old Town are crowded. Pancho's takos has the usual line. Bar at margaritagrill, no seats open, taste of Italy was packed. Most everyone we talked to was Canadian. Everyone having PV fun
Don't go! Corona virus is in PV!
#12 I am curious about the source of your information. It is hard to keep up with all of the info, but the last I heard there was none in Jalisco. Just wondering.......
Trolls causing panic should be banned.
